body_html:
Just stumbled upon this while trying to build the pytorch on my android table running a GNURoot Debian. After the modifying the constructor from Scalar() : Scalar(0L) {} to Scalar() : Scalar(int64_t(0)) {} the build step succeeded.

--- The following is basically a bread crumb for anyone who might have tried to execute a similar scenario and got frustrated by it(Searching specifically for "Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems" was returning only two hits in google search):
Although, this is related to Gloo, the installation failed when trying to build it due the cpu of the system not being registered as x64 (Its arm7l). I got prompted with:
"Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems"
As I would have no use for it in this deployment, I basically turned-off the validation for it.
Commented out:
if(NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 8)
message(FATAL_ERROR "Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems.")
endif()
in ~/torch/lib/gloo/CMakeLists.txt

After this the installation succeeded and the build is operational

My purpose for going out of my way to install Torch in this way (I am aware its rather questionable considering how doing so with a 32-bit device with no CUDA capability basically cuts it down in terms of capability) was due to having access to my jupyter notebooks that I had taken on another machine for PyTorch, to be accessible via my tablet as well.

Just stumbled upon this while trying to build the pytorch on my android table running a GNURoot Debian. After the modifying the constructor from  **Scalar() : Scalar(0L) {}** to **Scalar() : Scalar(int64_t(0)) {}** the build step succeeded. 

--- The following is basically a bread crumb for anyone who might have tried to execute a similar scenario and got frustrated by it(Searching specifically for "Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems" was returning only two hits in google search):
Although, this is related to [Gloo](https://github.com/facebookincubator/gloo/tree/0c9766691d77eb54c5a3293bc29621a82424fabb), the installation failed when trying to build it due the cpu of the system not being registered as x64 (Its arm7l). I got prompted with:
"Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems"
As I would have no use for it in this deployment, I basically turned-off the validation for it.
Commented out:
if(NOT CMAKE_SIZEOF_VOID_P EQUAL 8)
  message(FATAL_ERROR "Gloo can only be built on 64-bit systems.")
endif()
in ~/torch/lib/gloo/CMakeLists.txt

After this the installation succeeded and the build is operational

My purpose for going out of my way to install Torch in this way (I am aware its rather questionable considering how doing so with a 32-bit device with no CUDA capability basically cuts it down in terms of capability) was due to having access to my jupyter notebooks that I had taken on another machine for PyTorch, to be accessible via my tablet as well.
